intro: Laennecia chihuahuana, commonly known as the Chihuahua laennecia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential for medicinal use.
